question: The testes are situated outside the abdominal cavity within a pouch called ______.
The ______ helps in maintaining the low temperature of the testes.
The temperature of the testes is ______°C lower than the normal internal body temperature.
A lower temperature is necessary for the process of ______.
Each testis in adults is ______ in shape.
Each adult testis has a length of about ______ cm.
Each adult testis has a width of about ______ cm.
The testis is covered by a ______ covering.
Each testis has about ______ compartments called testicular lobules.
Each compartment of the testis is called a testicular ______.
Each lobule contains one to three highly coiled ______ tubules.
Sperms are produced in the ______ tubules.
Each seminiferous tubule is lined on its inside by male germ cells and ______ cells.
Male germ cells are also called ______.
Spermatogonia and Sertoli cells line the inside of the ______ tubules.
Male germ cells undergo ______ divisions to form sperm.
Sertoli cells provide ______ to the germ cells.
The regions outside the seminiferous tubules are called ______ spaces.
Interstitial spaces contain small blood vessels and ______ cells.
Leydig cells are present in the ______ spaces.
Leydig cells synthesise and secrete testicular hormones called ______.
Testicular hormones secreted by Leydig cells are called ______.
______ cells are also present in the interstitial spaces along with Leydig cells.
Each testicular lobule contains one to three ______ seminiferous tubules.
Interstitial spaces contain blood vessels and ______ cells.
The male germ cells finally lead to ______ formation.
Spermatogonia and Sertoli cells are found inside ______ tubules.
Leydig cells secrete ______ hormones.
Sertoli cells provide nutrition to the ______ cells.
Leydig cells are shown in ______ 2.2.
Testicular lobules are shown in ______ 2.1b.
The ______ are situated outside the abdominal cavity.
Each ______ tubule is lined with spermatogonia and Sertoli cells.
Interstitial cells are also called ______ cells.
The function of Sertoli cells is to provide ______.
Androgens are synthesised and secreted by ______ cells.
Spermatogenesis occurs at a temperature ______ than body temperature.
The male sex accessory ducts include rete testis, vasa efferentia, epididymis and ______.
The seminiferous tubules of the testis open into the vasa efferentia through ______.
The vasa efferentia leave the testis and open into ______.
The ______ is located along the posterior surface of each testis.
The epididymis leads to ______.
The vas deferens ascends to the abdomen and loops over the ______.
Vas deferens receives a duct from ______ vesicle.
The vas deferens opens into urethra as the ______ duct.
The ejaculatory duct opens into the ______.
These ducts store and transport the ______ from the testis to the outside.
Sperms are transported from the testis to the outside through the ______.
The urethra originates from the ______.
The urethra extends through the ______ to its external opening.
The external opening of the urethra is called ______ ______.
The ______ tubules of the testis open into the vasa efferentia.
The ______ leads to vas deferens.
The vas deferens loops over the ______ ______.
The ejaculatory duct is formed by the union of vas deferens and a duct from the ______ vesicle.
Sperms are stored and transported by the male ______ ducts.
The urethral meatus is the ______ opening of the urethra.
The urethra passes through the penis to reach the ______ ______.
The ______ ______ stores and transports sperms from the testis.
The vas deferens opens into the ______ as the ejaculatory duct.
The vasa efferentia carry sperms from rete testis to the ______.
The urethra extends from the urinary bladder through the ______.
